The board is now laying A-K-8-2 with two clubs.  
I hold Q♦ 7♣ (no pair, no flush draw yet).  
Best realistic outs: 9 cards that make a straight with a Jack or 9 additional clubs that miss if a fourth club comes, but the draw looks thin, expensive, and may already be dead against an Ace or King.  
At the moment this is still a bluff-catcher rather than a value hand.  

[Check]
